channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Strong yet superelastic ceramic aerogel enabled by synergistic soft-hard inter-nanowire nodes
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 21 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66339-x

This study reports ceramic nanowire aerogels with dual SiO2/PyC nodes that combine high strength and elasticity, overcoming the typical strength–elasticity trade-off through a synergistic soft–hard structural design.
item.dc:title: Strong yet superelastic ceramic aerogel enabled by synergistic soft-hard inter-nanowire nodes
item.dc:creator: De Lu
Lei Su

item.title: Ultrafast nonthermal electron transfer at plasmonic interfaces
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 21 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66640-9

This study uncovers how light polarization governs ultrafast charge transfer between gold and gallium nitride (GaN), revealing a low-loss, nonthermal electron pathway that could advance solar energy conversion and optoelectronic technologies.
item.dc:title: Ultrafast nonthermal electron transfer at plasmonic interfaces
item.dc:creator: Yuying Gao
Jonathan Diederich
Yuxin Xie
Qianhong Zhu
Christian Höhn
Karsten Harbauer
Fengtao Fan
Can Li
Roel van de Krol
Dennis Friedrich

item.title: Hybrid TiO<sub>2</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> nanolayer overcoating enhances dental lithium disilicate glass-ceramics acid resistance and surface mechanical properties
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 21 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66560-8

The acid in the oral cavity can corrode lithium disilicate restorations’ surface structure. This study coated a stably bonded TiO2/Al2O3 hybrid nanolayer on their surface via atomic layer deposition to enhance acid resistance and surface mechanical properties, without affecting transparency.
item.dc:title: Hybrid TiO<sub>2</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> nanolayer overcoating enhances dental lithium disilicate glass-ceramics acid resistance and surface mechanical properties
item.dc:creator: Xiaoxuan Zhang

item.title: Strength-plasticity synergy from ambient to high temperature via gradient-ordering in boride-reinforced WTaV medium-entropy alloy
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 21 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66617-8

Interfacial segregation of boron generates gradient-ordering and achieves improved mechanical performance across ambient temperature to 2073 K, providing a new pathway to overcome the strength-plasticity trade-off under extreme thermal conditions.
item.dc:title: Strength-plasticity synergy from ambient to high temperature via gradient-ordering in boride-reinforced WTaV medium-entropy alloy
item.dc:creator: Bo Sun
